newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Kim Young-sam demands N.Korea apology on submarine.
newsitem.headline: Kim Young-sam demands N.Korea apology on submarine.

text.p: South Korean president Kim Young-sam on Monday demanded an apology from North Korea over the intrusion of a submarine last month.
"North Korea should confess, make an apology and promise not to make the same kind of provocation again," he said in a speech for delivery to the National Assembly.
Prime Minister Lee Soo-sung was scheduled to deliver the speech to parliament.

Kim was referring to the incursion of a Shark-class submarine that landed 26 North Koreans on an east coast beach on September 18. Twenty two have been killed and one captured, and North Korea has threatened to retaliate.

"If they push us beyond our endurance, we will take stern steps under the Korea-US joint defence posture," according to an advance copy of the speech. The U.S. maintains 37,000 troops in South Korea to deter any North Korean military action.
Kim urged North Korea to respond to four party peace talks, including the United States and China, to replace a truce that ended the 1950-53 Korean War with a peace arrangement.
